result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy A Hermosillo Jr.

records.addlTxt: Not to be in the presence or possession of any drug paraphernalia. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Not to be in the presence or possession of any drug paraphernalia. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1:15 PM Defendant Randy A Hermosillo Jr. appeared by video, in custody from the Dunn Co Jail.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen appeared by video for Randy A Hermosillo Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - asking for $500 sign bond - Not to be in the presence or possession of any drug paraphernalia. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Atty Lundeen - no objection
Court - orders $500 sign bond - Not to be in the presence or possession of any drug paraphernalia. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

INIT
Atty Lundeen - Deft waives reading & speedy trial
        pleads not guilty 
Court - schedules return date
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 6, 2023 at 08:45 am.
